title: Police find gun used in shooting in Nashua river​​
content:
NASHUA, N.H. —
The Nashua Police Department dive team found three guns in the Nashua River Monday, one of which was used in a shooting over the weekend.
At 7:30 p.m. Saturday, Nashua police responded to a downtown residence for a report of a juvenile who sustained a gunshot wound
The teen was taken to a local hospital with non-life-threatening injuries but was later taken to a Boston hospital for follow-up care.
Investigators identified Christopher Baxter, 19, of Nashua as a suspect and obtained a warrant for his arrest.
Nashua police found Baxter at 2:30 p.m. Sunday and took him into custody.
He is being charged with reckless conduct and falsifying physical evidence.
Baxter was held on $100,000 cash bail pending his arraignment in Nashua on Monday.
Nashua police tweeted Monday that they have located four stolen handguns in the last week.
In the past week we have located 4 stolen handguns, 1 of which shot a juvenile. This is your department working to keep your streets safe.
— Nashua Police (@NashuaPolice) November 14, 2016
